question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Task Spawn Race] Does spawning multiple tasks in the loop (lines 128-208) without proper synchronization allow tasks to execute out of order, causing transactions to be written with incorrect version metadata? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Channel Buffer Overflow] Can the tokio::sync::mpsc::channel with buffer size 10 on line 149 fill up faster than do_upload can process, causing tasks to block indefinitely and leading to deadlock or resource exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Scope Lifetime Issue] Can tasks spawned in tokio_scoped::scope outlive the scope due to async operations, causing use-after-free or accessing deallocated self references when the scope ends? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Unwrap on Channel Send] Does the unwrap() in do_upload call on line 156 panic if the channel receiver is dropped, causing the entire backfiller to crash mid-operation without proper error handling? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [FileStoreOperatorV2 State Corruption] Can concurrent FileStoreOperatorV2 instances on line 133 share state that leads to race conditions in buffer management, causing transactions to be written to wrong files or with incorrect metadata? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Progress File Write Race] Can progress file updates on lines 217-219 be interrupted or race with concurrent backfiller instances, causing progress to be lost or set to incorrect values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Non-Atomic Progress Update] Is the progress file write operation non-atomic, allowing partial writes that corrupt the file and prevent backfill restart after crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Task Count Overflow] Can backfill_processing_task_count multiplied by num_transactions_per_folder overflow u64 when calculating total versions processed per iteration, causing incorrect loop termination or memory allocation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [GRPC Authentication Bypass] Does create_grpc_client on line 162 establish unauthenticated connections to fullnode_grpc_address, allowing attackers to MITM the connection and inject malicious transactions into the backfill? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [GRPC Request Tampering] Can an attacker modify the GetTransactionsFromNodeRequest on lines 163-166 in transit or through DNS poisoning to fetch transactions from arbitrary version ranges, causing data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Panic on GRPC Error] Does the panic! on line 196 when GRPC stream returns error cause the entire backfiller to crash on transient network issues, requiring manual restart and potentially leaving partial data written? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Unwrap on GRPC Response] Does unwrap() on line 170 panic if get_transactions_from_node fails, causing backfiller crash without retry mechanism or error recovery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Stream Termination Attack] Can a malicious fullnode terminate the GRPC stream early (line 173) without error, causing the backfiller to silently skip transactions and create gaps in the file store? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Response Unwrap] Does unwrap() on line 177 panic on malformed GRPC responses, allowing a malicious fullnode to DoS the backfiller by sending responses without the response field? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Chain ID Validation Bypass] Can assert! on line 176 be compiled out in release builds, allowing transactions from different chains to be processed without validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Chain ID Type Mismatch] Can chain_id casting from u64 to u32 on line 145 cause high bits to be truncated, allowing transactions from wrong chain (e.g., chain 0x100000001 matching 0x1) to pass validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [GRPC Client Reuse] Is a new GRPC client created for each task on line 162, preventing connection pooling and causing resource exhaustion when many tasks run concurrently? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Missing TLS Validation] Does the GRPC client connection skip TLS certificate validation, allowing MITM attacks where attackers inject fake transactions into the backfill process? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Transaction Count Validation] Can the fullnode return fewer or more transactions than transactions_count requested (line 165), causing version misalignment and gaps or overlaps in the file store? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Transaction Version Tampering] Can a malicious fullnode send transactions with manipulated version numbers that don't match task_version, causing incorrect file paths and data corruption in do_upload? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Transaction Order Validation] Are transactions validated to be in sequential order with no gaps, or can a malicious fullnode reorder transactions causing state inconsistencies in downstream indexers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Duplicate Transaction Detection] Can the same transaction be sent multiple times in the stream, causing it to be written to the file store repeatedly and wasting storage space? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Empty Transaction List] Can Response::Data contain an empty transactions list on line 179, causing the backfiller to proceed without writing any data and creating gaps in version coverage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Transaction Signature Validation] Are transaction signatures validated before writing to file store, or can a malicious fullnode inject unsigned/invalid transactions that corrupt the indexer state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Status Response Handling] Does Response::Status on line 190 get silently skipped with continue, allowing a malicious fullnode to send status responses instead of data to avoid sending actual transactions? (Medium)
